channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2024080015
item.description:
Report X-2024080015

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-05T15:15:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: AZTEC
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Based on my experience with tracking limited quantity packages I know that the outer box did not have any labels declaring it was a HAZMAT of any kind Limited Quantity or not based on Hub using a separate scan for NC/IC belt additional care scans which was not used in this case. Not sure if it's relevant, I had to call an associate from Summit Racing in order to get the SDS and he himself said that it was not available outside the company.

item.title: Report E-2024070767
item.description:
Report E-2024070767

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-02T18:16:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-19
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 19, 2024, two (2) 55-pound bags of UN1457 were torn in transit and released approximately two (2) cups of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Advanced Environmental Services (AES) to remediate the impacted site. AES personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070642
item.description:
Report E-2024070642

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-30T12:20:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-20
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 20, 2024, at 1605 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Albuquerque, New Mexico regarding the release of Ecolab Aqua Balance Pool and Spa Disinfectant. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 15 gallons of Ecolab Aqua Balance Pool and Spa Disinfectant (UN1791, 8, III) from (1)15-gallon plastic drum. The release was caused by a puncture from a pallet due to a load shift and contained to a 3ft x 25ft area of the trailer floor, and a 4ft x 2ft area of asphalt beneath the trailer. Contractors placed the damaged empty drum in an overpack then cleaned the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The overpack was secured in the trailer to be forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.
